Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bowl
Description: Conical bowl with a slightly rounded base and straight mouth. The interior surface is black and has been burnished horizontally. The exterior surface is pink-beige and has been decorated. The lower section bears a red slip which has been burnished vertically. The upper section bears a frieze of overlapping triangles filled with lines, realised using the same red colouring. Between the two sections, there is a horizontal band with irregular contours which shows the original aspect of the surface.
